programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry adopts a disguise at an auction in Stanton, while Darrell gets himself banned from bidding.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 19th-century sun dial cannon arrives at the shop, but it remains to be seen whether Rick will blast out the big bucks or if the deal will fizzle out.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1944 steel penny rolls into the shop, and the team also has a look at an 1850s calendar clock, an HR Giger lithograph from the film Alien 3, and a Smokey the Bear puppet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth confront the fact that Ashley's attitude is costing them much-needed business, and a customer with a fascination with serial killers brings in some scary paraphernalia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is swindled out of thousands of dollars after a crafty seller flogs him a fake luxury watch, so he tries to find a way to get his money back.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores a vacuum cleaner once used on train carriages, and transforms a man's childhood wagon.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick visits a Las Vegas museum to restore a 1950s air raid siren, and the team also tries to refurbish a nickel-plated till from the 1900s.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Scott Wolter acquires a piece of Captain's Kidd's treasure, launching him to Madagascar, where the trail leads to an ancient Templar fortress that holds valuable clues. Just up the coast, in Pirate Bay, Barry Clifford's team discovers a new shipwreck they believe might be a Templar vessel.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The discovery of a senior student's body at a university in Southern Illinois, striking fear into the hearts of everyone else on campus.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit a country town with a thriving art scene, and Victor competes to buy an antique train set.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Carrollton, where the lots up for auction include hunting gear and glass-blowing equipment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tries to prove to his staff that he is still an integral part of the pawn business after he makes a series of bad purchases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les is horrified when he discovers the shop has been broken into and the security system has been disabled, so he sets out to try to catch the thief.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: The trail leads to India where Barry Clifford checks out an island that may contain the most fabled Templar treasure - the Flaming Cross of Goa.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Contemplating the motivations behind alien visits to Earth, such as the desire to experiment on the human body and mind.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit a cemetery in Texas said to contain the body of an alien who crash-landed on Earth in 1897.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale fixes up a strength-tester from an arcade and a tiny vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a 1930s refrigerator into a wine box, while the team tries to fix a coffee machine from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members are intrigued when 18th-century engravings of the Spanish Armada arrive at the shop, along with explicit wax recordings from the 1890s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team test drives a 1950s Chrysler Town & Country Newport, and a cubist painting by New Zealand artist Louise Henderson arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover their latest purchase could be worth $25,000, while Darrell buys some video game memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend auctions in Cedar Hill, where they compete over voodoo statues, boxes of barbecue sauce and prosthetic limbs from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders compete over collectible dolls, antiques and a strange coin, which supposedly has the means to prevent the end of the world.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: A new group of competitors are tasked with using odd shapes of mystery steel to forge a blade, before two go on to recreate the sacred and lethal Talwar sword.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford takes a final shot at digging up lost Templar treasure, while Scott Wolter uncovers an important relic that may be a link to the Templar-Pirate connection.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: As the world moves into the digital age, more people are capturing images in the sky that they are unable to explain, leading to an influx of reported accounts of alien encounters.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: For years many people have argued that UFOs are terrestrial in reality. Though they may be correct, it is unlikely to be in the way that they think they are.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine an ancient Hindi scripture about a giant flying creature landing on Earth, and consider if this could be a description of an alien spacecraft.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds set up an elaborate sting to catch the thief and hope they have enough evidence to involve the police.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: High Noon in the High Desert
programme.desc: Barry discovers the personal possessions of rap magnate Suge Knight, while Jarrod and Dave aim to buy a classic organ.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod Schulz and Dave Hester explore a maze-like storage centre and set their sights on hand-crafted bamboo fishing rods.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A first edition of The Adventures of Bob Hope comic gets Rick and Chum chuckling, and an ancient Egyptian mummy mask gets Corey all wrapped up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Limited edition Batman and Joker Bolin Guitars swoop into the shop, and a bronze sculpture by ML Snowden also grabs the attention.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Storm tries to make his mark with Dwane and the crew. The team collect a slimy alternative to urchin, and Dwane faces a boisterous seven gill shark..

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.sub-title: A Truckload of Crocs - Part Three
programme.desc: It is the boys' final chance to reach their target of wrangling 30 crocodiles in one week up in the Northern Territory, but time is running out.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: At the Finniss River Station, Matt is forced to act quickly when he spots a huge crocodile in the paddock where the cattle are heading.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover their latest purchase could be worth $25,000, while Darrell buys some video game memorabilia.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Greg Proops, David O'Doherty, Reginald D Hunter and regular panellist Alan Davies know about jungles, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at the events of June 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Australian TV presenter and comedienne Julia Zemiro makes her debut on the obscure general knowledge quiz, joining Sue Perkins, Ross Noble and regular panellist Alan Davies to answer Stephen Fry's fiendish questions on the theme of jeopardy.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Greg Proops, David O'Doherty, Reginald D Hunter and regular panellist Alan Davies know about jungles, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at the events of June 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The guys sort through their haul from Italy, packing a shipping container with retro scooters, antique furniture and religious artefacts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are pitted against the Taylors in San Pedro, where they bid on shipping containers worth a fortune.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and Brandon argue, giving Scott and Chrissy a chance to jump in with their bid.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit a contact living in Sicily, who offers to show them around a treasure-filled house.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit a funeral home and a prosthetic limb factory, and examine a collection of vintage toys.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: A 1931 Model A Ford gets the rat rod overhaul care of Steve Darnell and the team. Cowboy bling on the interior and a new paint job are among the modifications.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers deal with a fire at a town centre block of flats, as well as breaking up fights, searching for illegal weapons and getting drunk drivers off the road.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around Â£2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version of the quiz in which Deirdre O'Kane, Richard Osman and David Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme of 'Occupations and Offices'. During the course of the show, the panellists are set fiendishly difficult questions that lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Greg Davies, Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans
programme.desc: Inbetweeners and Man Down star Greg Davies plays host for another session of stand-up at Hammersmith Apollo in west London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans take the mic.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Ed Gamble gets reckless with a frying pan, Katy Wix asks for a pencil and Jo Brand shares a leisurely sandwich with David Baddiel.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Julian Clary, Ross Noble, Bill Bailey and regular panellist Alan Davies know about jumpers, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Professor Brian Cox, Rhys Darby, Jason Manford and regular panellist Alan Davies know about justice, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage sketches from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Spoonerism, Hampton Wick and music by Tina Charles.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including an instalment of Hampton Wick and sketches Elizabeth Ah Ah and Ronnie Barker's Yearbook.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Russian Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary exploring the overthrow of the Tsar and the rise of the Soviet state, using archive footage and dramatic reconstructions. When the Tsar ordered military force to be used against the demonstrators, many soldiers began to question their loyalties, forming a revolutionary committee to plot against their commanding officers.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep underground.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the theory that Nazis were engaged in building spacecraft before the outbreak of the Second World War.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep underground.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage sketches from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Spoonerism, Hampton Wick and music by Tina Charles.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including an instalment of Hampton Wick and sketches Elizabeth Ah Ah and Ronnie Barker's Yearbook.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detectives connect the killing of a gypsy woman near Glasgow to a policeman stabbed in London during a jewel robbery, but their inquiries are hampered by a team from the Met.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Bob Hoskins stars in the first of a lavish two-part adventure based on Arthur Conan Doyle's novel about a British scientific team's 1911 expedition into the uncharted Amazon jungle in search of prehistoric life. Maverick Professor Challenger leads the quest for a mythical plateau, aiming to prove his theory that dinosaurs still roam certain parts of the Earth.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Steve Evans meets a mystery woman and soon realises that she is more closely linked to the army than he would like. Mark finds himself breaking the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is sedated in maternity and wakes up to find she cannot remember the tragic events of the previous week. Will's attitude problem causes trouble in the canteen, leading to another run-in with Connie. Jess tells Sean she is not ready to break the news about the baby to her father - but that's the least of her worries after she goes for a scan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's colleagues demonstrate their support for him in the sexual harassment case being brought by Mrs O'Donnell, while a local journalist claims to have injured his wrist in a bid to get to the heart of the story.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Celestine tries to reassure Etta about Lloyd, and Sharon is upset about Grant making plans for the future without consulting her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ethel is forced to make a difficult decision, one that has serious consequences for a very close friend.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A new station commander arrives and causes friction in the team as he implements a stricter regime. Meanwhile, a fire is started at a local primary school.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie's sea-faring brother dies, so the Boswells decide it would be fitting to arrange a burial at sea. Carla Lane's comedy, starring Jean Boht and Ronald Forfar.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The store advertises on Citizen Band radio, but unfortunately Mrs Slocombe's attempt to publicise her underwear attracts the attentions of the wrong type of customer. Shop-floor comedy, with Mollie Sugden and featuring the voice of Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean opens another secretarial agency, but needs someone to run it. Work for Lionel seems to have dried up, giving her cause for concern. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps people in Wolverhampton sort the treasures from their trash, including a miners' lamp, a Scottish drinking vessel, and a lot of gold items.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends from Dundee answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Vicky, Dexter, Francesca and Dave, who have never met before, pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: During the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Jai is stressed and exhausted, while Laurel is left horrified.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Tens of thousands of Newcastle United fans pass through the Metro for a home game on the first day of the new football season - and many of them are far from pleased with the club's owner. A guide horse undergoes training on the Metro system before moving to London, and in Sunderland, a crackdown on fare dodgers gets underway.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A touring dance extravaganza comes to Midsomer, but nobody sees the vicious rivalries and long-running feuds that are brewing behind the scenes - at least not until they erupt into murder. Barnaby's investigation into the killing of a dancer is complicated by an unexpected visit from his father, while the sponsor of the event is at the centre of a conflict of his own as he tries to decide who should inherit his fortune. Guest starring Nigel Havers and Christopher Timothy, as well as former Strictly Come Dancing stars Cassidy Little, Faye Tozer, Danny Mac, Natalie Gumede and Tom Chambers.

credits.actor: as well as former Strictly Come Dancing stars Cassidy Little

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how to build a port ready to receive the world's biggest container ships, and how 28 million plastic bags are made every day.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has a 1931 Cadillac ready for auction, and is asked to restore the brakes on a re-creation of a 1937 Bugatti Atlantique.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A sinkhole swallows an entire neighbourhood, a speedboat crashes at 140mph, a plane ices over at 18,000ft and a huge explosion destroys a chemical plant.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A factory fire, a 135mph motorcycle crash, how a nine-storey building collapsed in Russia, and the explosion of a Titan rocket. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Extreme Loggers
programme.desc: A look at Vancouver Island, where heli-loggers face all manner of dangers as they fell trees while working alongside helicopters that can carry five-tonne loads.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team sets to work renovating a 1963 Comet, which was bought as a present for a girl who passed her exams.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how to make Parmesan cheese, and the key to keeping the runways operating at the world's busiest airports. Plus, manufacturing reclining chairs.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers behind Drew Pritchard's antiques empire save an iconic Eames lounge chair. They also revive an unusual 90-year old oil lamp and a glamourous steam trunk.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The freezing conditions lead to problems for the crews as the Cornelia Marie's deckhand Dave Gilbert loses his footing. Meanwhile, the men of the Maverick suffer repeated electric shocks as they try to fix broken equipment in soaking conditions.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: A hastily welded winch roller gives way on the Christine Rose, releasing a cable that throws a crewman overboard, while Scott Meisterheim insists on diving despite an injured leg.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Mark brings a city to a standstill with his multi-million dollar load, Yogi is on an antiques roadshow where time is of the essence and Turbo is in a dirt-road marathon dogfight.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide the classic 1980s muscle car, the Ford Mustang GT, is the ideal, affordable vehicle for an aspiring mechanic to start working on.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Broomey is tasked with transporting a 55-tonne aircraft tow truck, which is itself charged with towing the Vulcan bomber for the Yeovilton Royal Naval Air Show.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Beneath the densely populated city of Naples lies a looming threat. A super volcano may be on the verge of erupting and causing an apocalyptic catastrophe.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: A steam joyride turns ugly as a magnificent steam train is vandalised. Plus, there is more drama in the outback as a 2,000-tonne freight train is in danger.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captain of the Rollo is furious to discover a miscalculation led to his crew overfishing, meaning they caught 40,000lbs more crab than their licence permits.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Captain Scott Meisterheim swallows his pride and invites Steve Riedel to rejoin the Wild Ranger crew, while the Sluicey finally enjoys some success.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard does battle at a castle in Essex, drives a hard bargain on automobile memorabilia, and an antiques emporium in Berkshire holds anatomical interest.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Sharon has to move a copper mountain, Sludge must shift a freight of highly flammable liquid, and mobile butcher Larry tries to save his meat from the heat.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Sensing the chance to get some bargains, Drew Pritchard checks in on some contacts who are downsizing and selling off collections. In Norwich, he finds a beautiful Victorian umbrella stand.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Mechanical failure and a mini twister hit Ally as he tries to bale a Â£10,000 grass harvest. Absent staff and a huge pie order put the heat on Ian and Stef in their farm bakery.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a piano stool, clock restoration expert Steve works on a vintage telephone and antique projector specialist Richard Rigby enlivens a magic lantern.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how the world's most expensive vinegar is made, how divers keep dry and warm in the freezing ocean, and how to build a plane that can fly upside down.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the process of forging super steel to make cars lighter, greener and safer, and how Australia's 80 million sheep are sheared every spring.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A student is abducted from a college campus. The only clue is a torn flip-flop, and after another similar assault agents soon suspect a serial offender may be at large.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The difficulties faced by forensic scientists and police in catching bombers and snipers, who often have no connection to their victims.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The Collector is a grisly tale that puts every woman's worst nightmare on the big screen. However for one fan, their obsession with the plot became reality.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 14-year-old April Millsap, whose body was recovered from a bike trail near the village of Armada, Michigan in July 2014. Millsap's dog, Penny, alerted a pair of joggers to the girl's remains. James VanCallis was later convicted of attempted sexually assault and murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the disappearance of a young woman in a small community led to a massive media campaign and nationwide hunt for a sadistic serial killer.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Members of the team rescue a cat trapped in a drain deep underground, and help an abandoned dog in danger of freezing to death.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown treats a baby cheetah, a shaking cavoodle and a pig.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Randy, I Think I Got This
programme.desc: A new consultant helps out with a surprise marriage proposal, while a former Miss USA has just one day to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Cindy and her mother hope to find a big, regal ball gown, and are surprised when her sister and best friend fly in from Miami.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Robin and Flo make a major faux pas by having two sisters model their wedding dresses for their family side by side.

programme.title: Bondi Vet Top Ten
programme.desc: A pair of peregrine falcons and a rabbit with a high libido receive help from Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet Top Ten
programme.desc: Two cousins are worried their Pomeranian has swallowed a bikini string, a terrier is fighting for life after being run over, and a python needs vitamins.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA staff and volunteers are called in to remove almost 200 birds and mammals from an animal sanctuary after allegations of neglect. An investigator is just in time to save four chihuahuas from starvation, while nine dogs and four cats are rescued from a filthy house.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators are called in when a drugs raid also uncovers roosters kept for fighting, while Dana Moss rescues two dogs on the verge of giving birth.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells a pink armchair, a rusty old bucket, and an unwanted painting before giving the profits to the owners.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The search for a murder suspect that led police to arrest two conspirators involved in the plot, who later implicated the victim's ex-husband.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of stonemason David Riemens, who attended one final meeting before driving home to visit his family. Soon after, his truck was found abandoned - with the 60-year-old nowhere to be seen.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Rico Harris, a former Harlem Globetrotter, who vanished in October 2014 while driving on a long trip to Seattle. Harris' car was found abandoned in a park 60 miles north-west of Sacramento and his mobile phone was located nearby. Investigators embarked on a quest that grew more baffling as time passed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sahar visits the salon with one wedding dress in mind, while Kristin returns for her fitting, but it is not the same outfit she originally bought.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sonya wants an expensive look on a budget, while Candice is getting married for a second time and seeks a dress to represent who she is now.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah visits the salon with her family, but her sister's opinion is the most important, while Bethany searches for a dress that goes against her mother's wishes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Comora hunts for a glamorous gown with the help of a celebrity consultant, and Randy tries to find two dresses to satisfy a customer with expensive taste.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Norah is shopping with her family, while the consultants search for a gown for a bride with a fashion savvy entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Porsha is obsessed with turtle-necks and hopes to find a dress that suits her style, while Randy hunts for a unique runway sample for a bride with a large budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jackie, who has worn many bridal gowns throughout her modelling career, tries to find the perfect dress for her big day, while Alia returns for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Visiting the bridal salon today are Dale, who has been waiting 30 years for her dream wedding, and Rachael, who wants to find a princess dress.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Seaton, Devon, Drew Pritchard dashes under a staircase for a pair of floodlights. In Yorkshire, he uses a penknife to see if a newly upholstered chair hides a valuable original.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells a pink armchair, a rusty old bucket, and an unwanted painting before giving the profits to the owners.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Randy's food addiction cost him his marriage and access to his daughter, so he endeavours to lose weight through surgery for her sake.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Addiction counsellor Bethany has got so big that she can no longer work. Now she risks losing her life if Dr Now cannot help her curb her own addiction.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: An infant's body is found in a box in a waterway. As detectives search for the killer, families wait anxiously for the victim's identity to be confirmed.
